dependencies.description:
Bazel is an open-source build and test tool similar to Make, Maven, and
Gradle. It uses a human-readable, high-level build language. Bazel
supports projects in multiple languages and builds outputs for multiple
platforms. Bazel supports large codebases across multiple repositories,
and large numbers of users.
dependencies.name: bazel

dependencies.description:
This repository is a collection of Python library code for building
Python applications. The code is collected from Google's own Python code
base, and has been extensively tested and used in production.
dependencies.name: py-absl-py

dependencies.description: Extended pickling support for Python objects.
dependencies.name: py-cloudpickle

dependencies.description:
The aim of the decorator module it to simplify the usage of decorators
for the average programmer, and to popularize decorators by showing
various non-trivial examples.
dependencies.name: py-decorator

dependencies.description:
tree is a library for working with nested data structures. In a way,
tree generalizes the builtin map() function which only supports flat
sequences, and allows to apply a function to each leaf preserving the
overall structure.
dependencies.name: py-dm-tree

dependencies.description: Python AST that abstracts the underlying Python version
dependencies.name: py-gast

dependencies.description:
Differentiate, compile, and transform Numpy code. JAX is a Python
library for accelerator-oriented array computation and program
transformation, designed for high-performance numerical computing and
large-scale machine learning.
dependencies.name: py-jax

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: TensorFlow is an open source machine learning framework for everyone.
dependencies.name: py-tensorflow

dependencies.description:
The TF-Keras library is a pure TensorFlow implementation of Keras, based
on the legacy tf.keras codebase. Note that the "main" version of Keras
is now Keras 3 (formerly Keras Core), which is a multi-backend
implementation of Keras, supporting JAX, PyTorch, and TensorFlow. Keras
3 is being developed at keras-team/keras.
dependencies.name: py-tf-keras

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description: NeuralGCM: Hybrid ML + Physics model of Earth's atmosphere.
dependent_to.name: py-neuralgcm

dependent_to.description: scalable pythonic model fitting for high energy physics
dependent_to.name: py-zfit

description:
TensorFlow Probability (TFP) is a Python library built on TensorFlow
that makes it easy to combine probabilistic models and deep learning on
modern hardware (TPU, GPU). It's for data scientists, statisticians, ML
researchers, and practitioners who want to encode domain knowledge to
understand data and make predictions.
name: py-tensorflow-probability

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
